text: While high quality entity translation is essential in cross-lingual information access and trans lation , it is non-trivial to achieve , due to the challenge that entity translation , though typically bearing pronunciation similarity , can also be arbitrary , e.g. , Jackie Chan and fiX : it ( pronounced Cheng Long ) .

claim: Corpus-based similarity can support arbitrary translations
text: Corpus-based similarity can support arbitrary translations , but require highly scarce resources of bilingual co-occurrences , obtained from parallel or comparable bilingual corpora .
